responsibilities: Guide, drive, and implement machine learning applications and solutions across the organization.
Define and execute advanced machine learning models and algorithms to solve complex business problems.
Stay at the forefront of the latest machine learning research to improve Unity’s Ad platform capabilities.
Optimize, improve, and innovate ML practices to establish Unity as an industry leader.
Form and validate hypotheses on new modeling aspects and potency of new datasets.
Drive optimization hypotheses by analyzing drivers for impactful ML solutions and building a development roadmap.
Communicate data and machine learning capability needs to product and engineering teams.
Drive the overall direction of machine learning for Ads to support strategic goals and vision.
qualifications: Expertise with modeling frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch).
Understanding of model architectures and mechanisms.
Ability to explain machine learning and interpret modeling efficacy.
Conducting analysis, statistics, and data literacy.
analysis:
The job responsibilities focus on guiding, driving, and implementing machine learning applications and solutions, defining and executing advanced machine learning models, and staying at the forefront of machine learning research. The responsibilities also include optimizing and innovating ML practices, forming and validating hypotheses on new modeling aspects, and driving optimization hypotheses for impactful ML solutions. The skills required include expertise with modeling frameworks like Tensorflow and PyTorch, understanding model architectures, and the ability to explain machine learning and interpret modeling efficacy.

While the job involves advanced machine learning and model development, there is no explicit mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The focus seems to be on machine learning applications in general, particularly for Unity's Ad platform, rather than specifically on GenAI or LLMs. The skills and responsibilities do not specifically indicate work with generative models or language models, which are typically associated with tasks like natural language processing, text generation, or other language-based AI applications.
